oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Evaluation of an Enzymatic Test for the Rapid Detection of Staphylococcus aureus in Milk
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Paré, J.
Bouchard, E.
Lévesque, A.
Lallier, R.
Guillemette, J. -M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Staphylococcus aureus
mastitis
enzymatic test
rapid detection
BHI
brain heart infusion
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Staphylococcus aureus is a contagious mastitis causing bacterium of cows. An enzymatic test for rapid detection of S. aureus in milk (Biovet) was evaluated in comparison with another rapid test (Hy-Mast, Upjohn), to standard bacteriological techniques including pre-culture enrichment in BHI (brain heart infusion) carried out in the clinical bacteriology laboratory of the College of Veterinary Medicine of the University of Montreal.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1998; 289
